numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph shows how much advantage wealthy legacy children have for getting into the country's top prestigious colleges.
2. I notice that a parent's income strongly affects the chance of acceptance.
3. I wonder if schools will defer more legacy applicants.
4. I wonder if schools will reject more legacy applicants.
5. These actions would make the process more fair for other applicants.
6. Some other applicants are more deserving than some legacy applicants.
7. This relates to me and my community.
8. Many of my friends applied to top schools.
9. I also applied to top schools.
10. Some of these top schools are schools that a sibling attended.
11. Some of these top schools are schools that a parent attended.
12. I am a senior in high school.
13. Over the past few months, I have become very familiar with this process.
14. I have heard about more legacy applicants in the early action pool.
15. Some of these legacy applicants got deferred.
16. Some of these legacy applicants were moved to regular decision.
17. The headline is: Is the college application process as fair as we think?
